results.content: Pretty much a rehash of w3schools tutorial in video format.  Very brief course for the price of the course.  This should be valued at no more than $5.00 max.
results.content_html: Pretty much a rehash of w3schools tutorial in video format. Very brief course for the price of the course. This should be valued at no more than $5.00 max.

results.content: Great detail!  It was face paced and precise, just what I needed to stay engaged.  Not a moment was wasted on unnecessary information.  Thank you!
results.content_html: Great detail! It was face paced and precise, just what I needed to stay engaged. Not a moment was wasted on unnecessary information. Thank you!

results.content: Makes xml schema easy to understand

The instructor speaks a bit too quickly. While this can be mitigated by slowing the video down a little, other problems (slurred words, the abundance of "umm", "you know", etc, and typos in the code) detracts from the content. I think the course could be significantly improved if the instructor read off of a stricter script, and kept a more moderate pace of speech. Also, multiply retakes of the video until one of sufficient quality is obtained would help too.

response.content:
Hello Ken,

Thank you for the detailed review. I will keep these points in mind in my upcoming courses.

-T

results.content: He made a lot of errors (syntax) during the teaching like left off the colon after xs, said maxOccurs was unboundes when it should be unbounded... just errors not corrected.  Also i really would like to see it actually used in a webpage or see the end to end concept of how to use it before just code in xsd and answers in xml.  How do you send the answers to it and then how do you submit the file to a database....then dive into the coding.
